title: SPTO Board of Directors resolutions to be submitted to Council of Tourism Ministers
text:
SPTO Board of Directors resolutions to be submitted to Council of Tourism Ministers   
Oct 15, 2015 eTN   
PAPEETE, Tahiti - The South Pacific Tourism Organisation (SPTO) Board of Directors met at the Le Meridien Resort in Papeete, Tahiti, today, 14th October, 2015. 
The meeting of the Directors was attended by the government representatives of American Samoa, China, Cook Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Fiji, French Polynesia, Kiribati, Nauru, New Caledonia, Niue, Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tonga, Tuvalu and Vanuatu. 
The Directors discussed issues related to SPTO’s policies, activities, work program and budget since the last meeting; and passed the following resolutions for due consideration by the Council of Ministers which meet on Thursday, 15th October. 
In the Board resolutions, the Directors have endorsed a number of resolutions for submission to the Council of Tourism Ministers for approval. 
The resolutions passed by the Directors included the approval of the 2016SPTO Work Plan and Budget, Pacific Cruise Tourism Development Strategy (PCTDS) 2015-2019 and high level policies pertaining to the SPTO Constitution. 
SPTO Chief Executive, Ilisoni Vuidreketi, said the Directors have also endorsed the brand development for SPTO which is expected to be launched at the South Pacific Tourism Exchange, in May 2016. 
“The brand development is a major undertaking for SPTO and we are grateful for the support of the Directors towards this project as we work to improve our brand image and keep abreast with technological advances in corporate branding”, he added. 
“I would also like to extend our gratitude to the Directors for their deliberations and discussions today. We covered a lot of ground in our talks and were always able to come to an amicable solution for the betterment of tourism in the Pacific region”, he added. 
The next SPTO Board of Directors meeting will be held in the Gold Coast, Australia, on May 20th and 21st during the 2016 South Pacific Tourism Exchange and the 2016 Council of Tourism Ministers meeting will be hosted in the Cook Islands.
